steps.title: Download and install the SkipTheDishes app.
steps.content: Download and install the SkipTheDishes app. It can be found on both the Google Play Store on Android and the Apple App Store on iOS .

steps.title: Create and configure your account.
steps.content: Create and configure your account. You have the option to link your Facebook, Google, or Apple account, or you may make a SkipTheDishes account with an email address. Input your name, a password, phone number, and email address. App settings allow you to update your account information, adjust notifications for order and delivery updates, and save multiple addresses.

steps.title: Confirm your location.
steps.content: Confirm your location. Your phone's GPS will estimate your location. Type in your home address or move the pin around the map to confirm.

steps.title: Pick a restaurant.
steps.content: Pick a restaurant. The home page displays restaurants that are currently open for delivery/pickup. Tap on a restaurant to view its menu. The search bar allows you to narrow the list down to specific cuisines and food types. The number beside the restaurant name is the Skip Score. This is a 1-10 rating based on reviews, popularity, and overall customer experience. You can choose to sort the listings based on Skip Score, estimate time of arrival, and delivery fee.

steps.title: Browse through the menu.
steps.content: Browse through the menu. The menu screen lists all available items, their descriptions, and prices.

steps.title: Choose the items you want to order.
steps.content: Choose the items you want to order. Tap on an item to view it in more detail. Specify the quantity and any special instructions. Tap Add to order when satisfied to add it to your cart. The special instructions text field allows you to request changes to that item (for instance, "no tomatoes"). If you or another person has a food allergy, this is where you would mention that. Some restaurants let you make modifications to an item directly. When an item gives a " x items still required" prompt, this means you will need to specify sides or add-ons. For example, if you're ordering a burger from a fast food restaurant, tapping that item allows you to customize your burger toppings, substitute a salad instead of fries, and choose an iced coffee instead of a soda.

steps.title: Review your order and check out.
steps.content: Review your order and check out. Tap on View order . This screen shows everything you've ordered and the subtotal. You can tap on an item to edit it if needed, remove, or add items. When you are satisfied, tap Checkout .

steps.title: Verify the checkout information.
steps.content: Verify the checkout information. This screen is where you double-check the information necessary for your order to be delivered. Confirm whether you want the order to be delivered to your doorstep or if you will be picking it up at the restaurant yourself. Select the order time. ASAP means the order will be placed and prepared immediately according to the restaurant's stated estimated time. You can also pre-order for delivery/pickup at a later time, Verify the delivery location. You may also include special driving instructions for the courier to follow (e.g. a buzzer code or unit number). Choose how much you'd like to tip the courier. 100% of your tip goes to the courier and SkipTheDishes never takes a cut. Optionally, add a voucher or promo code for discounts.

steps.title: Select your payment method.
steps.content: Select your payment method. SkipTheDishes supports Visa, MasterCard, and American Express cards, as well as Google Pay and Apple Pay. Input your card number, expiry date, and CVV (3-4 digit security code). You can save this card on your account for next time. When satisfied, tap Select payment . You can also choose to redeem your Skip Reward points (requires the most latest app update) for discounts on your order. Otherwise, the "Don't use points" option is enabled by default.

steps.title: Place the order.
steps.content: Place the order. Once everything looks good, tap Place order to send it off to the restaurant. You should receive a confirmation email shortly.

steps.title: Wait for the restaurant to confirm the order.
steps.content: Wait for the restaurant to confirm the order. Once it's confirmed, the restaurant will begin its preparation. At this point, the screen will change to a map with an estimated time for delivery.

steps.title: Track your order's progress.
steps.content: Track your order's progress. Once your order is almost prepared, the app will assign a nearby courier. You'll receive periodic updates on the status of your order and see the remaining delivery time. The map view allows you to track in real-time the location of your courier as he/she drives.

steps.title: Meet the courier.
steps.content: Meet the courier. Shortly before the courier's estimated arrival time, you should receive a notification giving you a head's up. If you've written down special instructions for the driver, he/she will try to follow them. If you have chosen to pick it up at the restaurant yourself, you'll instead receive an update indicating the order is almost ready. When you arrive at the restaurant, let the staff know you are picking up an online order through SkipTheDishes and give your order number (on invoice) or phone number.

steps.title: Give feedback on the restaurant and courier.
steps.content: Give feedback on the restaurant and courier. Although this is entirely optional, providing a brief review helps to improve the experience for other customers. Restaurants are responsible for your order's preparation, accuracy, and packaging. Couriers are responsible for transportation and handling.
